member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.ConditionalAttribute
member.summary: Serves as a base class for attributes which support conditional schema generation.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.ConditionalAttribute.ConditionGroup
member.summary: Identifies the condition group under which this attribute applies.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.ExclusiveMaximumAttribute
member.remarks: The `value` parameter is provided in the constructor as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.ExclusiveMaximumAttribute.#ctor(System.Double)
member.remarks: The parameter is provided as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.ExclusiveMinimumAttribute
member.remarks: The `value` parameter is provided in the constructor as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.ExclusiveMinimumAttribute.#ctor(System.Double)
member.remarks: The parameter is provided as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.IfAttribute
member.summary: Creates or amends a condition group by expecting a value in a property.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.IfAttribute.Value
member.remarks: The compiler will allow any compile-time constant, however only JSON-compatible values will work.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.IfAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.param: The expected value for the property (should be JSON-compatible).

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.IfEnumAttribute
member.summary: Creates multiple condition groups based on the value of an enum property, one group for each defined enum value.
member.remarks: The enum type is inferred from the property.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.IfEnumAttribute.UseNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use numbers or names in the condition. Default is to use names.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.IfEnumAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.param: (optional) Whether to use numbers or names in the condition. Default is to use names.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.IfMaxAttribute
member.summary: Creates or amends a condition group by defining an expected maximum value in a property.
member.remarks: The specific keywords which are added depend on the type of the targeted property.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.IfMaxAttribute.IsExclusive
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the value should be exclusive.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.IfMaxAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Double,System.Object)
member.param: The expected maximum value for the property.
member.remarks: The parameter is provided as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted when applied as the `maximum` or `exclusiveMaximum` keywords.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.IfMinAttribute
member.summary: Creates or amends a condition group by defining an expected minimum value in a property.
member.remarks: The specific keywords which are added depend on the type of the targeted property.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.IfMinAttribute.IsExclusive
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the value should be exclusive.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.IfMinAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Double,System.Object)
member.param: The expected minimum value for the property.
member.remarks: The parameter is provided as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted when applied as the `minimum` or `exclusiveMinimum` keywords.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.JsonExcludeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the property should be excluded from generation.
member.remarks: This attribute functions exactly the same as the . It is included separately to support the case where the model should be serialized with a property but schema generation should ignore it.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.JsonNumberHandlingAttributeHandler.AddConstraints(Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase,System.Attribute)
member.summary: Processes the type and any attributes (present on the context), and adds intents to the context.

member.remarks: The `value` parameter is provided in the constructor as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.MaximumAttribute.#ctor(System.Double)
member.remarks: The parameter is provided as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.MinimumAttribute
member.remarks: The `value` parameter is provided in the constructor as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.MinimumAttribute.#ctor(System.Double)
member.remarks: The parameter is provided as a `double` but stored as a `decimal` because `decimal` is not a valid attribute parameter type. As such, to prevent overflows, the value is clamped to the `decimal` range prior to being converted.

member.summary: Indicates a property is required and should be listed in the `required` keyword.

member.summary: Whether the items should be unique.

member.summary: Whether the property should be write-only.

member.summary: Creates a new instance with a value of `true`.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.ContextExtensions.GetAttributes(Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase)
member.summary: Gets the attribute set. Type contexts get type attributes; member context get member attributes.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.GeneratorRegistry.Register(Json.Schema.Generation.Generators.ISchemaGenerator)
member.remarks: Registration is order dependent: last one wins. If you have multiple generators which can handle a given type, the last one registered will be used.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.Generators.ISchemaGenerator
member.remarks:
Generators are the first stage of schema generation. These will add keyword intents to the context, which then are translated into keywords after optimization.
Implementations MUST also override

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.Generators.ISchemaGenerator.Handles(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether the generator can be used to generate a schema for this type.
member.returns: `true` if the generator can be used; `false` otherwise.

member.summary: Processes the type and any attributes (present on the context), and adds intents to the context.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.IAttributeHandler
member.summary: Defines requirements to handle converting an attribute to a keyword intent.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.IAttributeHandler.AddConstraints(Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase,System.Attribute)
member.summary: Processes the type and any attributes (present on the context), and adds intents to the context.
member.remarks: A common pattern is to implement on the attribute itself. In this case, the parameter will be the same instance as the handler and can likely be ignored.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.IAttributeHandler`1
member.summary: Processes attributes of type that are present on a type or member and adds intents to the context.
member.typeparam: The type of the attribute that is handled.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.IContextContainer
member.summary: Indicates to the generation system that this object contains contexts.
member.remarks: Implement this on your to indicate that it contains other contexts. Intents that need this are generally associated with applicator keywords, such as `items` and `allOf`.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.IContextContainer.Replace(System.Int32,Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase)
member.param: The hashcode of the context to replace.
member.remarks: To implement this, call on the contained contexts. If any match, replace them with .

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.ISchemaKeywordIntent
member.summary: Describes the intent to create a keyword.
member.remarks:
Because is immutable, the system cannot generate the schema directly as it needs to do some optimization first. Keyword intents allow this. They record all of the data needed by the keyword. Application involves translating the intent into an actual keyword on the using one of the fluent extension methods provided by . Custom intents will need to be applied from within custom implementations.
Implementations MUST also override

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.ISchemaRefiner
member.remarks: Refiners run after attributes have been processed, before the schema itself is created. This is used to add customization logic.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.ISchemaRefiner.ShouldRun(Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase)
member.summary: Determines if the refiner should run.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.ITypeNameGenerator.GenerateName(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates a `$defs` key for a type.
member.returns: A string to use for the type; null to use the library-provided behavior.

member.summary: Gets the context this is based on.

member.summary: Gets the set of member attributes.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.Nullability
member.summary: Indicates whether to apply `null` to the `type` keyword.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.Nullability.Disabled
member.summary: Indicates that `null` will not be included.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.Nullability.AllowForNullableValueTypes
member.summary: Indicates that `null` will be applied to types.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.Nullability.AllowForReferenceTypes
member.summary: Indicates that `null` will be applied to reference types.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.Nullability.AllowForAllTypes
member.summary: Indicates that `null` will be applied to both reference types and types.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNameResolver
member.summary: Declares a property name resolution which is used to provide a property name.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNameResolvers
member.summary: Defines a set of predefined property name resolution methods.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNameResolvers.AsDeclared
member.summary: Makes no changes. Properties are generated with the name of the property in code.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNameResolvers.LowerSnakeCase
member.summary: Property names to lower snake case (e.g. `lower_snake_case`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNameResolvers.UpperSnakeCase
member.summary: Property names to upper snake case (e.g. `UPPER_SNAKE_CASE`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNameResolvers.UpperKebabCase
member.summary: Property names to upper kebab case (e.g. `UPPER-KEBAB-CASE`).

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethod
member.summary: Declares a property naming method which is used to alter property names.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods
member.summary: Defines a set of predefined property naming methods.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.AsDeclared
member.summary: Makes no changes. Properties are generated as they are declared in code.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.CamelCase
member.summary: Updates property names to camel case (e.g. `camelCase`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.PascalCase
member.summary: Updates property names to pascal case (e.g. `PascalCase`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.SnakeCase
member.summary: Updates property names to snake case (e.g. `Snake_Case`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.LowerSnakeCase
member.summary: Updates property names to lower snake case (e.g. `lower_snake_case`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.UpperSnakeCase
member.summary: Updates property names to upper snake case (e.g. `UPPER_SNAKE_CASE`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.KebabCase
member.summary: Updates property names to kebab case (e.g. `Kebab-Case`).

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyNamingMethods.UpperKebabCase
member.summary: Updates property names to upper kebab case (e.g. `UPPER-KEBAB-CASE`).

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyOrder
member.summary: Indicates the sequence in which properties will be listed in the schema.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyOrder.AsDeclared
member.summary: Properties will be listed in the order they're declared in code.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.Generation.PropertyOrder.ByName
member.summary: Properties will be sorted by name, case-insensitive.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase
member.summary: Provides base functionality and data for generation contexts.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase.ReferenceCount
member.summary: The number of times this context has been referenced.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase.Intents
member.summary: The keyword intents required for this type.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase.Hash
member.summary: A calculated hash value that represents and identifies this context.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase.#ctor(System.Type)
member.param: The type represented by the context.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextBase.Apply(Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder)
member.returns: The schema builder (for fluent syntax support).

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextCache
member.summary: Gets the contexts for the current run.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextCache.Get(System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Attribute})
member.summary: Gets or creates a based on the given type and attribute set.
member.param: A collection of extra attributes. Only use if requesting a context to represent a member.
member.returns: A generation context, from the cache if one exists with the specified type and attribute set; otherwise a new one. New contexts are automatically cached. If is null or empty, a will be returned; otherwise a .
member.remarks: Use this in your generator if it needs to create keywords with subschemas.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGenerationContextOptimizer
member.summary: Provides meta-data about the generation process.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration
member.summary: Provides additional configuration for the generator.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.Generators
member.summary: A collection of generators in addition to the global set.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.PropertyOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the order in which properties will be listed in the schema.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.PropertyNamingMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the property naming method. Default is .
member.remarks: This can be replaced with any `Func<string, string>`.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.PropertyNameResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets the property name resolving method. Default is .
member.remarks: This can be replaced with any `Func<MemberInfo, string>`.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.Nullability
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to include `null` in the `type` keyword. Default is which means that it will not ever be included.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.Optimize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether optimizations (moving common subschemas into `$defs`) will be performed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.StrictConditionals
member.summary: Gets or sets whether properties that are affected by conditionals are defined globally or only within their respective `then` subschemas. True restricts those property definitions to `then` subschemas and adds a top-level `unevaluatedProperties: false`; false (default) defines them globally.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Generation.SchemaGeneratorConfiguration.Current
member.summary: Thread-static storage of the current configuration. Only to be used for reading the configuration. Setting values on this object will be overwritten when starting generation.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.TypeExtensions.IsArray(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether the type is a simple, one-dimensional, non-keyed collection.
member.returns: true if the type represents an array; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Generation.TypeExtensions.IsNullableValueType(System.Type)
